metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the win-def:user_test is properly supported.
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the win-def:user_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.
Information regarding the registry on your particular machine can be found by navigating to Start -> Run... and by typing 'mmc' and adding the Local Users and Groups Snap-in.

criterion.comment: Test that a user_object is supported.
Test that a user_object pattern match is supported.
Test that a user_object not equals is supported.

user_test.comment: Test that a user_object is supported.
Test that a user_object pattern match is supported.
Test that a user_object not equals is supported.

user_object.comment: Retrieves a user_object where user equals the 'ADMINISTRATOR' account.
Retrieves a user_object where user matches the regular expression '.*'.
Retrieves a user_object where user is not equal to the 'Guest' account.

user_state.comment: This state represents a user_object where user equals the 'ADMINISTRATOR' account.
This state represents a user_object where user matches the regular expression '.*'.
This state represnets a user_object where user is not equal to 'Guest'.
